how to reinstall modules marked as missing



  • 2009-09-23 07:12:11

    how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    If you are asking for help, provide lots of detail so problems can be reproduced.

    Things to describe:
    Operating system ATutor is installed on - centos 5.2
    ATutor version - 1.6.2
    Patch #s applied -
    ATutor theme name -
    PHP version - 5.1.6
    MySQL version - 5.0.45
    Webserver & version -
    Copies of error messages -
    Changes to default settings -
    Web browser being used -
    ...and anything else relevant -

    I have upgraded from 1.5.2 to 1.6.2 and after a while I noticed that assignment,file storage and reading list moudules are marked as missing, when I tried to enable those, the server told me to reinstall. Would you please let me know how to fix this problem, as our students need to upload their file into courses with this modules.


  • 2009-09-23 10:14:46

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    These are old modules that are now integrated into the ATutor source code.

    You just need to re enable them in the Course Tools.


  • 2009-09-26 00:47:52

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    I checked out course tool as instructor but I didn't find those modules (file storage and assignments, ...), would you please guide me more specific. As I already mentioned those modules are in the module section but marked as missing.


  • 2009-09-26 08:32:15

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    As the administrator, look under the Modules tab and re-enable them.


  • 2009-09-26 08:48:40

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    Do the folders identified as missing exist.

    When you uploaded the new ATutor prior to upgrading, did you do so file-by-file, or did you upload the tar.gz file and unpack it on the server?

  • 2009-09-27 06:51:40

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    I could solve this problem by changing status of these modules in mysql.
    Now I need to know why students can delete files that instructor put on file storage. Please let me know how can I disable "delete" for students in file storage


  • 2009-09-27 09:12:22

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    If you upload to the Course Files folder, students can not delete files.


  • 2009-09-28 00:49:32

  • 2009-09-28 09:45:21

    Re: how to reinstall modules marked as missing

    I assumed you were talking about the File Storage utility. Upload file to the Course File folder.

    See the Handbook if you need more details.
